Simmons II</Pname> <Plocation> Staff Director</Plocation> </people> <people> <Pname>Zach Steacy</Pname> <Plocation> Legislative Operations</Plocation> </people> <Doc-title>ORGANIZATIONAL MEETING FOR THE 115TH CONGRESS</Doc-title> <option> ---------- House of Representatives, Committee on Armed Services, Washington, DC, Thursday, January 12, 2017. The committee met, pursuant to call, at 2:08 p.m., in room 2118, Rayburn House Office Building, Hon. William M. ``Mac'' Thornberry (chairman of the committee) presiding. </option>
Hearing.Statement: <opening>OPENING STATEMENT OF HON. WILLIAM M. ``MAC'' THORNBERRY, A</opening> <paragraph paraId="2" speaker="HON. WILLIAM M. ``MAC'' THORNBERRY"> REPRESENTATIVE FROM TEXAS, CHAIRMAN, COMMITTEE ON ARMED </paragraph> <speaker>The Chairman. The committee will come to order</speaker> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">Today, we have at this portion three items of official business to consider: adoption of the rules, the security procedures, and the appointment of committee staff.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">Before we do that, let me just take a brief moment and welcome returning and new members to the committee and also express some condolences to those members who are here with us for a day and are being forced to leave us after this.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">The truth is this is a special committee. Most people believe that it is the President or the military's job to decide how big the military ought to be and what weapons they ought to have and so forth. If you look at Article 1, Section 8, it says it is Congress' responsibility to raise and support armies, to provide and maintain a navy, to make rules for the government and regulation of the land and naval forces of the United States. That puts the responsibility on our shoulders, and it is a significant responsibility because, as we all know, men and women volunteer to serve our Nation and defend us and put their lives at stake, but they are counting on us.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">The rest of the story is, for 55 straight years, Congresses, with majorities from both parties, and Presidents of both parties have found a way to come together and pass a national defense authorization bill, 55 straight years.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">Now, there have been some hiccups along the way. It hadn't always been easy, but that bipartisan tradition of coming together for the men and women who serve for the security of our Nation is also something, I think, that weighs on us and our responsibilities.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker="The Chairman. The committee will come to order">This year, we have got to exercise those responsibilities in a world that is growing more dangerous and more complex. We are going to work hard. We are going to have lots of sessions of various kinds, but I am very excited about the tremendous breadth and depth of talent on both sides of the aisle that this committee has. And I very much look forward to working with each of you and the contributions that each of you will make to our product this year.</paragraph>

<opening>STATEMENT OF HON. ADAM SMITH, A REPRESENTATIVE FROM WASHINGTON,</opening> <paragraph paraId="1" speaker="HON. ADAM SMITH">Let me yield to the distinguished ranking member for any comments he makes before we move on to the rules.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="2" speaker="HON. ADAM SMITH"> RANKING MEMBER, COMMITTEE ON ARMED SERVICES </paragraph> <speaker>Mr. Smith</speaker> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker="Mr. Smith">Thank you, Mr. Chairman.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker="Mr. Smith">I would merely echo your comments. I think you described the job of this committee very well. It is a great committee. I have been privileged to serve on it for 20 years under a number of different chairs in both parties. I think the fact that we work together in a bipartisan way to produce a very important product every year makes this committee, frankly, unique in the House at this point.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker="Mr. Smith">And I have enjoyed working with you, respect the way you run the committee, and I look forward to an interesting year. We have a lot to do, to be sure. But as you said, we have very, very talented members of this committee. And I guess the only thing I would add, which I know you have said many times as well, we also have an incredibly talented staff that does an enormous amount of work and makes this possible. So I thank them as well and look forward to working with all of you in the year ahead.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker="Mr. Smith"> I yield back. </paragraph> <speaker>The Chairman. I thank the gentleman</speaker> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman"/> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman">Let me go ahead and call up Committee Resolution No. 1, regarding the committee rules for the 115th Congress. The clerk will read the resolution.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman"> Dr. Bright. Committee Resolution No. 1. Resolved, that the Committee on Armed Services, U.S. House of Representatives, adopt the committee rules for the 115th Congress, which are stated in the copy distributed to each member. </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman"> The Chairman. The proposed committee rules have been </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="10" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman">Dr. Bright. Committee Resolution No. 1. Resolved, that the Committee on Armed Services, U.S. House of Representatives, adopt the committee rules for the 115th Congress, which are stated in the copy distributed to each member. developed jointly with the ranking member and made available to members' offices earlier this week following consultation with</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="11" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman">I ask unanimous consent the resolution be considered as read and the resolution be open to amendment at any point.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="12" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman">Without objection, it is so ordered.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman"> [GRAPHICS NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="The Chairman. I thank the gentleman"> The Chairman. Let me just say that the committee rules </paragraph>
